headline: DeWine signs bill naming section of Route 86 in honor of Staff Sgt. Kyle McKee
author: Editorial Staff
sentences:
“Kyle made the ultimate sacrifice, and this legislation will stand as a memorial to his service and the loss suffered by the McKee family and the Lake County community.”
McKee, a Leroy Township native and Riverside High School graduate, enlisted in the Army in 2002, between his junior and senior years of high school.

During his service, McKee received over 20 military awards, including the Army Achievement Medal, the Meritorious Service Medal and the Global War on Terrorism Service Medal, according to a news release.
Kyle R. McKeeOn Nov. 12, 2020, McKee and five other soldiers were killed when their UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter crashed during a peacekeeping mission in Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula.

Mike DeWine has signed House Bill 291 into law which designates a portion of state Route 86 in Leroy Township as the “SSG Kyle R. McKee Memorial Highway.”
.U.S.
After graduation, he fully entered military service and became a UH-60 helicopter repairer, according to sponsor testimony submitted by Callender and Troy.
Editor’s note: This article was updated at 4:19 p.m. April 22 to correct the spelling of the last name of Jamie Callender
McKee was sent around the world during his military service, being deployed to Iraq, Afghanistan, South Korea and Egypt.
“Staff Sergeant Kyle McKee is a hero who died protecting everything we as Americans cherish,” Troy said in the release.
The bill was jointly sponsored by state Reps. Daniel P. Troy, D-Willowick, and Jamie Callender, R-Concord Township.
He was 35 and left behind a wife and three children.
